de.hfu.anybeam.networkCore

Class NetworkEnvironment

  • java.lang.Object
    • de.hfu.anybeam.networkCore.NetworkEnvironment

  • public class NetworkEnvironment
extends java.lang.Object
    Able to find counterparts in the local network.
    Since:
    1.0
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    chrwuer

      • startClientSearch

        public void startClientSearch()
        Starts a active, "infinite" (365 day) search for Clients in the local network. Remember to cancel it, especially on mobile devices!
        See Also:
        startClientSearch(long, TimeUnit), startClientSearch(long, TimeUnit, long, TimeUnit)

      • startClientSearch

        public void startClientSearch(long howLong,
                     java.util.concurrent.TimeUnit unitHowLong)
        Starts a active search for Clients in the local network. The search is automatically cancelled after the given time.
        Parameters:
        howLong - the duration of the search
        unitHowLong - the TimeUnit of howLong
        See Also:
        startClientSearch(), startClientSearch(long, TimeUnit, long, TimeUnit)

      • startClientSearch

        public void startClientSearch(long howLong,
                     java.util.concurrent.TimeUnit unitHowLong,
                     long pause,
                     java.util.concurrent.TimeUnit unitPause)
        Starts a active search for Clients in the local network. The search is automatically cancelled after the given time. The signals are send in the given interval.
        Parameters:
        howLong - the duration of the search
        unitHowLong - the TimeUnit of howLong
        pause - the time between the signals
        unitPause - the TimeUnit of pause
        See Also:
        startClientSearch(), startClientSearch(long, TimeUnit, long, TimeUnit)

      • cancelClientSearch

        public void cancelClientSearch()
        Cancels the active client search. Does nothing if no search is active.

      • clearClientList

        public void clearClientList()
        Removes all Clients from the list of reachable Clients.
